title: AGENTS.md
text: file provides context epidatatools R package.

title: AGENTS.md
text: epidatatools R package containing various data tools used Economic Policy Institute.

title: AGENTS.md
text: list main user-facing functions available package: averaged_quantile(x, w, probs, na.rm, quantiles_n, quantiles_w): Calculates averaged (smoothed) quantile numeric vector. averaged_median(x, w, na.rm, quantiles_n, quantiles_w): Calculates averaged (smoothed) median numeric vector. find_bls(search_string, max_results, metadata, survey, seasonality): Searches BLS Data Finder series matching search string returns series IDs titles. Can optionally restrict search specific BLS survey filter seasonal adjustment. find_fred(search_string, max_results, metadata, seasonality): Searches FRED database series matching search string returns series IDs titles. Can optionally return additional metadata filter seasonal adjustment (NULL, “NSA”, “SA”). get_bea_nipa(tables, years, frequency, underlying, metadata, bea_api_key): Retrieves National Income Product Accounts (NIPA) data Bureau Economic Analysis (BEA) API. Requires BEA API key. Supports NIPA NIUnderlyingDetail datasets. tables parameter can named vector add custom names (e.g., c("gdp" = "T10101")) adds “name” column first column. Returns tibble table_name, table_description, line_number, line_description, date_frequency, date, value, date variables appropriate frequency data returned (annual data includes year; quarterly data includes year quarter; monthly data includes year, quarter, month). metadata=TRUE, also includes unit_mult, metric_name, cl_unit, series_code, note_text (list column containing notes API response). get_bea_regional(geo_fips, table_name, line_code, year, metadata, bea_api_key): Retrieves regional economic data Bureau Economic Analysis (BEA) API. Requires BEA API key. Takes single table_name line_code (“” line codes), allows multiple geo_fips years. single geo_fips can state abbreviation (e.g., “NY”). Returns tibble geo_fips, geo_name, table_name, table_description, line_number, line_description, date_frequency, date, year, value. metadata=TRUE, also includes cl_unit, mult_unit, note_text (list column containing notes API response). Results sorted geo_fips, table_name, line_number, date. get_bls(series, start, end, metadata): Retrieves data Bureau Labor Statistics (BLS) API. Requires BLS API key. crosstab(data, ..., w, percent): Creates cross-tabulation one two variables data frame. get_fred(series, start, end, metadata): Retrieves data Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) API. Requires FRED API key. interpolated_quantile(x, bin_size, probs, w, na.rm): Calculates binned interpolated quantile numeric vector. interpolated_median(x, bin_size, w, na.rm): Calculates binned interpolated median numeric vector. binipolate(data, x, probs, bin_size, ., w): Summarizes data frame binned interpolated percentiles. dl_ipums_micro(extract): Downloads selection IPUMS microdata extracts. Requires IPUMS API key. dl_ipums_acs1(years, variables, description, ...): Downloads IPUMS ACS 1-year files. dl_ipums_asec(years, variables, description, ...): Downloads IPUMS CPS ASEC files. dl_ipums_cps(months, variables, description, ...): Downloads IPUMS Monthly CPS files. merge_status(x, y, ...): Joins two data frames creates _merge indicator column show merge status (left_only, right_only, ). summarize_groups(.data, .groups, ...): Summarizes distinct groups data frame.

title: AGENTS.md
text: state_geocodes: data frame 51 rows 8 variables containing geographic codes US states including FIPS codes, Census codes, region/division classifications. Variables: state_name, state_abb, state_fips, state_census, division, division_name, region, region_name.

title: AGENTS.md
text: changes package (functions, documentation, data), run following commands rebuild verify: commands must run verify code ready released.
code: devtools::document()  # Regenerate documentation devtools::test()      # Run testthat tests devtools::check()     # Run R CMD check to verify package integrity pkgdown::build_site() # Build the pkgdown documentation site

title: AGENTS.md
text: package uses testthat testing. Tests located tests/testthat/.

title: AGENTS.md
code: devtools::test()                              # Run all tests devtools::test(filter = "api-no-duplicates") # Run specific test file

title: AGENTS.md
text: Tests API functions (get_bls(), get_bea_nipa(), get_bea_regional()) require API keys set environment variables: - BLS_API_KEY BLS functions - BEA_API_KEY BEA functions Tests skipped automatically required API keys available.

title: AGENTS.md
text: test-api--duplicates.R: Verifies API functions return duplicate data rows. added catch regressions bug multiple series queries returned duplicated observations.

what: Data tools used at the Economic Policy Institute
title: Data tools used at the Economic Policy Institute
text: epidatatools contains functions find useful EPI don’t exact analogues elsewhere R package ecosystem.

title: Data tools used at the Economic Policy Institute
code: library(epidatatools)  crosstab(mtcars, cyl) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>     cyl     n percent cumul_percent #>   <dbl> <int>   <dbl>         <dbl> #> 1     4    11   0.344         0.344 #> 2     6     7   0.219         0.562 #> 3     8    14   0.438         1  crosstab(mtcars, cyl, gear) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>     cyl   `3`   `4`   `5` #>   <dbl> <int> <int> <int> #> 1     4     1     8     2 #> 2     6     2     4     1 #> 3     8    12     0     2  # weighted counts expressed as column percentages crosstab(mtcars, cyl, gear, w = mpg, percent = "column") #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>     cyl    `3`   `4`   `5` #>   <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     4 0.0890 0.732 0.528 #> 2     6 0.163  0.268 0.184 #> 3     8 0.748  0     0.288

title: Data tools used at the Economic Policy Institute

title: Data tools used at the Economic Policy Institute
code: averaged_median(mtcars$mpg) #> [1] 19.2  p = c(10, 50, 90)  mtcars |>   dplyr::reframe(     p,     value = averaged_quantile(mpg, probs = p / 100)   ) #>    p  value #> 1 10 13.832 #> 2 50 19.200 #> 3 90 30.108

title: Data tools used at the Economic Policy Institute
text: Requires valid IPUMS API key stored .Renviron IPUMS_API_KEY.
code: # First make sure you have a valid IPUMS API key stored in your .Renviron file as `IPUMS_API_KEY`.  # CPS ASEC microdata dl_ipums_asec(2021:2022, c("YEAR", "OFFPOV", "ASECWT"))  #> DDI codebook file saved to /tmp/RtmpGaUUhf/cps_00161.xml #> Data file saved to /tmp/RtmpGaUUhf/cps_00161.dat.gz #> Use of data from IPUMS CPS is subject to conditions including that users should cite the data appropriately. Use command `ipums_conditions()` for more details. #> # A tibble: 316,275 × 11 #>     YEAR SERIAL MONTH       CPSID ASECFLAG ASECWTH PERNUM  CPSIDP  CPSIDV ASECWT #>    <dbl>  <dbl> <int+lbl>   <dbl> <int+lb>   <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1  2021      1 3 [March] 2.02e13 1 [ASEC]    706.      1 2.02e13 2.02e14   706. #>  2  2021      1 3 [March] 2.02e13 1 [ASEC]    706.      2 2.02e13 2.02e14   706. #>  3  2021      1 3 [March] 2.02e13 1 [ASEC]    706.      3 2.02e13 2.02e14   608. #>  4  2021      2 3 [March] 2.02e13 1 [ASEC]   1537.      1 2.02e13 2.02e14  1537. #>  5  2021      2 3 [March] 2.02e13 1 [ASEC]   1537.      2 2.02e13 2.02e14  1537. #>  6  2021      2 3 [March] 2.02e13 1 [ASEC]   1537.      3 2.02e13 2.02e14  2119. #>  7  2021      3 3 [March] 2.02e13 1 [ASEC]   1499.      1 2.02e13 2.02e14  1499. #>  8  2021      8 3 [March] 2.02e13 1 [ASEC]    948.      1 2.02e13 2.02e14   948. #>  9  2021      8 3 [March] 2.02e13 1 [ASEC]    948.      2 2.02e13 2.02e14  1225. #> 10  2021      8 3 [March] 2.02e13 1 [ASEC]    948.      3 2.02e13 2.02e14   948. #> # ℹ 316,265 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: OFFPOV <int+lbl>

what: Get data from the BLS API
title: Data tools used at the Economic Policy Institute
text: Requires valid BLS FRED API keys stored .Renviron IPUMS_API_KEY.
code: # To run this example you will need a BLS API key  # in your .Renviron file named BLS_API_KEY  bls_series_ids = c(   prime_age_epop = "LNS12300060",   injuries_annual = "ISU00000000031004" )  get_bls(bls_series_ids, start = 2023, end = 2023) #> # A tibble: 13 × 8 #>    name       series_id series_title date_frequency date        year month value #>    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>        <chr>          <date>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-01-01  2023     1  80.3 #>  2 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-02-01  2023     2  80.5 #>  3 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-03-01  2023     3  80.7 #>  4 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-04-01  2023     4  80.7 #>  5 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-05-01  2023     5  80.7 #>  6 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-06-01  2023     6  80.9 #>  7 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-07-01  2023     7  80.9 #>  8 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-08-01  2023     8  80.8 #>  9 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-09-01  2023     9  80.8 #> 10 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-10-01  2023    10  80.6 #> 11 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-11-01  2023    11  80.7 #> 12 prime_age… LNS12300… (Seas) Empl… month          2023-12-01  2023    12  80.5 #> 13 injuries_… ISU00000… Industry-le… year           2023-01-01  2023     1   2.6

what: Get data from the FRED API
title: Data tools used at the Economic Policy Institute
code: # To run this example you will need a FRED API key  # in your .Renviron named FRED_API_KEY  fred_series_ids = c(   gdp = "GDP",   unemployment_rate = "UNRATE" )  get_fred(fred_series_ids, start = as.Date("2024-06-01"), end = 2024) #> # A tibble: 10 × 9 #>    name     series_id series_title date_frequency date        year quarter month #>    <chr>    <chr>     <chr>        <chr>          <date>     <dbl>   <int> <dbl> #>  1 gdp      GDP       Gross Domes… quarter        2024-04-01  2024       2     4 #>  2 gdp      GDP       Gross Domes… quarter        2024-07-01  2024       3     7 #>  3 gdp      GDP       Gross Domes… quarter        2024-10-01  2024       4    10 #>  4 unemplo… UNRATE    Unemploymen… month          2024-06-01  2024       2     6 #>  5 unemplo… UNRATE    Unemploymen… month          2024-07-01  2024       3     7 #>  6 unemplo… UNRATE    Unemploymen… month          2024-08-01  2024       3     8 #>  7 unemplo… UNRATE    Unemploymen… month          2024-09-01  2024       3     9 #>  8 unemplo… UNRATE    Unemploymen… month          2024-10-01  2024       4    10 #>  9 unemplo… UNRATE    Unemploymen… month          2024-11-01  2024       4    11 #> 10 unemplo… UNRATE    Unemploymen… month          2024-12-01  2024       4    12 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: value <dbl>

title: Data tools used at the Economic Policy Institute

code: install.packages("epidatatools", repos = c("https://economic.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

title: Calculate the averaged (smoothed) median — averaged_median
text: Calculate averaged (smoothed) median

title: Calculate the averaged (smoothed) median — averaged_median
code: averaged_median(   x,   w = NULL,   na.rm = TRUE,   quantiles_n = 9L,   quantiles_w = c(1:4, 5, 4:1) )

title: Calculate the averaged (smoothed) median — averaged_median
text: x numeric vector R object w numeric vector sample weights length x giving weights use elements x na.rm logical; true, NA NaN's removed x computation quantiles_n integer number quantiles used averaging; must odd quantiles_w weights used average quantiles; length must equal quantiles_n

title: Calculate the averaged (smoothed) median — averaged_median
text: scalar

code: averaged_median(x = mtcars$mpg) #> [1] 19.2

title: Calculate the averaged (smoothed) quantile — averaged_quantile
code: averaged_quantile(   x,   w = NULL,   probs = 0.5,   na.rm = TRUE,   quantiles_n = 9L,   quantiles_w = c(1:4, 5, 4:1) )

title: Calculate the averaged (smoothed) quantile — averaged_quantile
text: x numeric vector R object w numeric vector sample weights length x giving weights use elements x probs numeric; percentile value [0,1] na.rm logical; true, NA NaN's removed x computation quantiles_n integer number quantiles used averaging; must odd quantiles_w weights used average quantiles; length must equal quantiles_n

title: Calculate the averaged (smoothed) quantile — averaged_quantile
text: numeric vector length probs

title: Calculate the averaged (smoothed) quantile — averaged_quantile
code: averaged_quantile(x = mtcars$mpg, probs = c(0.25, 0.5, 0.75)) #> [1] 15.392 19.200 22.812

code: binipolate(data, x, probs = 0.5, bin_size, .by = NULL, w = NULL)

title: Summarize a data frame as binned interpolated percentiles — binipolate
text: data data frame x column compute probs numeric vector percentiles values [0,1] bin_size size binning .optional, tidy-selection columns single-operation grouping w numeric vector weights length x giving weights use elements x

title: Summarize a data frame as binned interpolated percentiles — binipolate

title: Summarize a data frame as binned interpolated percentiles — binipolate

title: Cross-tabulate one or two variables — crosstab
text: Cross-tabulate one two variables

title: Cross-tabulate one or two variables — crosstab
code: crosstab(data, ..., w = NULL, percent = NULL)

title: Cross-tabulate one or two variables — crosstab
text: data data frame ... one two variables, one- two-way cross-tabulation w weight percent two-way cross-tabulation, replace counts row column percentages NULL, default, shows counts rather percentages "row" replace counts row percentages, summing 100% across columns within row "column" replace counts column percentages, adding 100% across rows within column

title: Cross-tabulate one or two variables — crosstab
text: tibble

title: Cross-tabulate one or two variables — crosstab
code: crosstab(mtcars, cyl) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>     cyl     n percent cumul_percent #>   <dbl> <int>   <dbl>         <dbl> #> 1     4    11   0.344         0.344 #> 2     6     7   0.219         0.562 #> 3     8    14   0.438         1     crosstab(mtcars, cyl, gear) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>     cyl   `3`   `4`   `5` #>   <dbl> <int> <int> <int> #> 1     4     1     8     2 #> 2     6     2     4     1 #> 3     8    12     0     2 crosstab(mtcars, cyl, gear, w = mpg, percent = "column") #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>     cyl    `3`   `4`   `5` #>   <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     4 0.0890 0.732 0.528 #> 2     6 0.163  0.268 0.184 #> 3     8 0.748  0     0.288

what: Find BLS Series by Search String — find_bls
title: Find BLS Series by Search String — find_bls
text: Searches BLS Data Finder series matching search string. Searches BLS Data Finder series matching search string.

title: Find BLS Series by Search String — find_bls
code: find_bls(   search_string,   max_results = 20,   metadata = FALSE,   survey = NULL,   seasonality = NULL )  find_bls(   search_string,   max_results = 20,   metadata = FALSE,   survey = NULL,   seasonality = NULL )

title: Find BLS Series by Search String — find_bls
text: search_string Character string search series titles max_results Maximum number results return (default: 20) metadata Logical flag retrieve catalog metadata (default: FALSE). FALSE, series_id series_title returned faster performance. survey Character string specifying BLS survey code restrict search (default: NULL). NULL, searches across surveys. See BLS Data Finder available survey codes (e.g., "cw" CPI Urban Wage Earners, "ln" Labor Force Statistics, "ce" Current Employment Statistics). seasonality Character string filter seasonal adjustment (default: NULL). NULL, filter applied. Use "SA" restrict seasonally adjusted series, "NSA" restrict seasonally adjusted series.

title: Find BLS Series by Search String — find_bls
text: tibble columns series_id, series_title, optionally metadata (list column containing catalog metadata one-row tibbles metadata = TRUE) tibble columns series_id, series_title, optionally metadata (list column containing catalog metadata one-row tibbles metadata = TRUE)

title: Find BLS Series by Search String — find_bls
code: find_bls("unemployment rate") #> # A tibble: 20 × 2 #>    series_id            series_title                                             #>    <chr>                <chr>                                                    #>  1 LNS14000000          (Seas) Unemployment Rate                                 #>  2 LNU04000000          (Unadj) Unemployment Rate                                #>  3 LNS14000006          (Seas) Unemployment Rate - old base in U.S. city average, urban wage earner… #>  4 CWURS49DSA0    "All items in Seattle-Tacoma-Bellevue, WA, urban wage earners… #>  5 CWURS49ASA0    "All items in Los Angeles-Long Beach-Anaheim, CA, urban wage … #>  6 CWURS49BSA0    "All items in San Francisco-Oakland-Hayward, CA, urban wage e… #>  7 CWSR0000SA0    "All items in U.S. city average, urban wage earners and cleri… #>  8 CWUR0400SA0    "All items in West urban, urban wage earners and clerical wor… #>  9 CWURS12ASA0    "All items in New York-Newark-Jersey City, NY-NJ-PA, urban wa… #> 10 CWUR0000SAM    "Medical care in U.S. city average, urban wage earners and cl… #> 11 CWURS23ASA0    "All items in Chicago-Naperville-Elgin, IL-IN-WI, urban wage … #> 12 CWUR0000SAH1   "Shelter in U.S. city average, urban wage earners and clerica… #> 13 CWUR0000SA0E   "Energy in U.S. city average, urban wage earners and clerical… #> 14 CWUR0300SA0    "All items in South urban, urban wage earners and clerical wo… #> 15 CWUR0000SETB01 "Gasoline (all types) in U.S. city average, urban wage earner… #> 16 CWUR0000SEMC01 "Physicians\\' services in U.S. city average, urban wage earn… #> 17 CWUR0000SEMD01 "Hospital services in U.S. city average, urban wage earners a… #> 18 CWUR0200SA0    "All items in Midwest urban, urban wage earners and clerical … #> 19 CWUR0000SEMF01 "Prescription drugs in U.S. city average, urban wage earners … #> 20 CWURS49ESA0    "All items in San Diego-Carlsbad, CA, urban wage earners and … if (FALSE) { find_bls("unemployment rate")  find_bls("wage", survey = "cw") }

what: Find FRED Series by Search String — find_fred
title: Find FRED Series by Search String — find_fred
text: Searches FRED database series matching search string.

title: Find FRED Series by Search String — find_fred
code: find_fred(   search_string,   max_results = 20,   metadata = FALSE,   seasonality = NULL,   fred_api_key = Sys.getenv("FRED_API_KEY") )

title: Find FRED Series by Search String — find_fred
text: search_string Character string search series titles max_results Maximum number results return (default: 20) metadata Logical flag retrieve additional metadata (default: FALSE). FALSE, series_id series_title returned. seasonality Optional filter seasonal adjustment: NULL (filter, default), "NSA" (Seasonally Adjusted), "SA" (Seasonally Adjusted) fred_api_key FRED API key (defaults FRED_API_KEY environment variable)

title: Find FRED Series by Search String — find_fred
text: tibble columns series_id, series_title, optionally metadata (list column containing additional metadata metadata = TRUE)

title: Find FRED Series by Search String — find_fred
text: function wrapper around fredr::fredr_series_search_text() requires FRED API key.

title: Find FRED Series by Search String — find_fred
code: if (FALSE) { find_fred("unemployment rate")  find_fred("GDP", max_results = 10)  find_fred("inflation", metadata = TRUE)  find_fred("employment population ratio", seasonality = "SA") }

what: Retrieve NIPA data from the BEA API — get_bea_nipa
title: Retrieve NIPA data from the BEA API — get_bea_nipa
text: Retrieves National Income Product Accounts data Bureau Economic Analysis API. Requires BEA API key saved BEA_API_KEY environment variable.

title: Retrieve NIPA data from the BEA API — get_bea_nipa
code: get_bea_nipa(   tables,   years,   frequency = c("year", "quarter", "month"),   underlying = FALSE,   metadata = FALSE,   bea_api_key = Sys.getenv("BEA_API_KEY") )

title: Retrieve NIPA data from the BEA API — get_bea_nipa
text: tables Character vector NIPA table names (e.g., "T10101", "T20305"). Can named vector add custom names. years Numeric vector years "" available years frequency Character string: "year" (annual), "quarter" (quarterly), "month" (monthly). Can specify multiple comma-separated string. underlying Logical flag use NIUnderlyingDetail dataset instead NIPA (default: FALSE) metadata Logical flag return additional metadata columns (default: FALSE) bea_api_key BEA API key (defaults BEA_API_KEY environment variable)

title: Retrieve NIPA data from the BEA API — get_bea_nipa
text: tibble columns: table_name, table_description, line_number, line_description, date_frequency, date, value, date variables (year, quarter, month) appropriate frequency data returned. Annual data includes year; quarterly data includes year quarter; monthly data includes year, quarter, month. metadata = TRUE, also includes unit_mult, metric_name, cl_unit, series_code, note_text (list column). tables named vector, includes "name" column first column.

title: Retrieve NIPA data from the BEA API — get_bea_nipa
code: get_bea_nipa("T10101", years = 2020:2024, frequency = "quarter") #> # A tibble: 500 × 9 #>    table_name table_description      line_number line_description date_frequency #>    <chr>      <chr>                        <int> <chr>            <chr>          #>  1 T10101     Table 1.1.1. what: Retrieve Regional data from the BEA API — get_bea_regional
title: Retrieve Regional data from the BEA API — get_bea_regional
text: Retrieves regional economic data Bureau Economic Analysis API. Requires BEA API key saved BEA_API_KEY environment variable.

title: Retrieve Regional data from the BEA API — get_bea_regional
code: get_bea_regional(   geo_fips,   table_name,   line_code,   year = NULL,   metadata = FALSE,   bea_api_key = Sys.getenv("BEA_API_KEY") )

title: Retrieve Regional data from the BEA API — get_bea_regional
text: geo_fips Character vector geographic FIPS codes, special values: "COUNTY" counties, "STATE" states, "MSA" MSAs. single value can also state abbreviation (e.g., "NY", "CA"). table_name Single table name (e.g., "CAINC1" personal income) line_code Single line code specifying statistic retrieve, "" line codes year Optional numeric vector years "" available years. Defaults "LAST5". metadata Logical flag return additional metadata columns (default: FALSE). TRUE, also includes cl_unit, mult_unit, note_text (list column). bea_api_key BEA API key (defaults BEA_API_KEY environment variable)

title: Retrieve Regional data from the BEA API — get_bea_regional
text: tibble columns: geo_fips, geo_name, table_name, table_description, line_number, line_description, date_frequency, date, year, value. metadata = TRUE, also includes cl_unit, mult_unit, note_text (list column containing notes API response).

title: Retrieve Regional data from the BEA API — get_bea_regional
code: get_bea_regional(geo_fips = "STATE", table_name = "SAINC1", line_code = 1) #> # A tibble: 300 × 10 #>    geo_fips geo_name   table_name table_description line_number line_description #>    <chr>    <chr>      <chr>      <chr>                   <int> <chr>            #>  1 00000    United St… SAINC1     SAINC1 State ann…           1 Personal income  #>  2 00000    United St… SAINC1     SAINC1 State ann…           1 Personal income  #>  3 00000    United St… SAINC1     SAINC1 State ann…           1 Personal income  #>  4 00000    United St… SAINC1     SAINC1 State ann…           1 Personal income  #>  5 00000    United St… SAINC1     SAINC1 State ann…           1 Personal income  #>  6 01000    Alabama    SAINC1     SAINC1 State ann…           1 Personal income  #>  7 01000    Alabama    SAINC1     SAINC1 State ann…           1 Personal income  #>  8 01000    Alabama    SAINC1     SAINC1 State ann…           1 Personal income  #>  9 01000    Alabama    SAINC1     SAINC1 State ann…           1 Personal income  #> 10 01000    Alabama    SAINC1     SAINC1 State ann…           1 Personal income  #> # what: Retrieve data from the BLS API — get_bls
title: Retrieve data from the BLS API — get_bls
text: function simply wrapper around blsR requires BLS API key saved BLS_API_KEY environment variable.

title: Retrieve data from the BLS API — get_bls
code: get_bls(   series,   start,   end,   metadata = FALSE,   bls_api_key = Sys.getenv("BLS_API_KEY") )

title: Retrieve data from the BLS API — get_bls
text: series BLS series code start Start year (numeric) end End year (numeric) metadata Flag additional metadata bls_api_key BLS API key (defaults BLS_API_KEY environment variable)

title: Retrieve data from the BLS API — get_bls
text: tibble

what: Retrieve data from the FRED API — get_fred
title: Retrieve data from the FRED API — get_fred
text: function simply wrapper around fredr requires FRED API key.

title: Retrieve data from the FRED API — get_fred
code: get_fred(   series,   start = NULL,   end = NULL,   metadata = FALSE,   fred_api_key = Sys.getenv("FRED_API_KEY") )

title: Retrieve data from the FRED API — get_fred
text: series FRED series code start Start year date (numeric year Date object) end End year date (numeric year Date object) metadata Flag additional metadata fred_api_key FRED API key (defaults FRED_API_KEY environment variable)

title: Retrieve data from the FRED API — get_fred
text: tibble

title: Retrieve data from the FRED API — get_fred
code: get_fred("UNRATE") #> # A tibble: 936 × 7 #>    series_id series_title      date_frequency date        year month value #>    <chr>     <chr>             <chr>          <date>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 UNRATE    Unemployment Rate month          1948-01-01  1948     1   3.4 #>  2 UNRATE    Unemployment Rate month          1948-02-01  1948     2   3.8 #>  3 UNRATE    Unemployment Rate month          1948-03-01  1948     3   4   #>  4 UNRATE    Unemployment Rate month          1948-04-01  1948     4   3.9 #>  5 UNRATE    Unemployment Rate month          1948-05-01  1948     5   3.5 #>  6 UNRATE    Unemployment Rate month          1948-06-01  1948     6   3.6 #>  7 UNRATE    Unemployment Rate month          1948-07-01  1948     7   3.6 #>  8 UNRATE    Unemployment Rate month          1948-08-01  1948     8   3.9 #>  9 UNRATE    Unemployment Rate month          1948-09-01  1948     9   3.8 #> 10 UNRATE    Unemployment Rate month          1948-10-01  1948    10   3.7 #> # ℹ 926 more rows  series = c(   gdp = "GDP",   urate = "UNRATE" ) get_fred(series, start = as.Date("2024-07-01"), end = 2024) #> # A tibble: 8 × 9 #>   name  series_id series_title     date_frequency date        year quarter month #>   <chr> <chr>     <chr>            <chr>          <date>     <dbl>   <int> <dbl> #> 1 gdp   GDP       Gross Domestic … quarter        2024-07-01  2024       3     7 #> 2 gdp   GDP       Gross Domestic … quarter        2024-10-01  2024       4    10 #> 3 urate UNRATE    Unemployment Ra… month          2024-07-01  2024       3     7 #> 4 urate UNRATE    Unemployment Ra… month          2024-08-01  2024       3     8 #> 5 urate UNRATE    Unemployment Ra… month          2024-09-01  2024       3     9 #> 6 urate UNRATE    Unemployment Ra… month          2024-10-01  2024       4    10 #> 7 urate UNRATE    Unemployment Ra… month          2024-11-01  2024       4    11 #> 8 urate UNRATE    Unemployment Ra… month          2024-12-01  2024       4    12 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: value <dbl>  complete_results = get_fred(series, start = 2020, end = 2025, metadata = TRUE) complete_results #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   name  series_id metadata          data              #>   <chr> <chr>     <list>            <list>            #> 1 gdp   GDP       <tibble [1 × 15]> <tibble [23 × 2]> #> 2 urate UNRATE    <tibble [1 × 15]> <tibble [72 × 2]>  complete_results |>   tidyr::unnest(metadata) #> # A tibble: 2 × 18 #>   name  series_id id     realtime_start realtime_end title     observation_start #>   <chr> <chr>     <chr>  <chr>          <chr>        <chr>     <chr>             #> 1 gdp   GDP       GDP    2025-12-23     2025-12-23   Gross Do… 1947-01-01        #> 2 urate UNRATE    UNRATE 2026-01-09     2026-01-09   Unemploy… 1948-01-01        #> # ℹ 11 more variables: observation_end <chr>, frequency <chr>, #> #   frequency_short <chr>, units <chr>, units_short <chr>, #> #   seasonal_adjustment <chr>, seasonal_adjustment_short <chr>, #> #   last_updated <chr>, popularity <int>, notes <chr>, data <list>

what: Calculate the binned interpolated median — interpolated_median
title: Calculate the binned interpolated median — interpolated_median
text: #' @description

title: Calculate the binned interpolated median — interpolated_median
code: interpolated_median(x, bin_size, w = NULL, na.rm = TRUE)

title: Calculate the binned interpolated median — interpolated_median
text: x numeric vector R object bin_size size used binning w numeric vector weights length x giving weights use elements x na.rm logical; true, NA NaN's removed x computation

title: Calculate the binned interpolated median — interpolated_median
text: numeric vector

title: Calculate the binned interpolated median — interpolated_median
text: function superceded EPI's current preferred method interpolating medians, averaged_median().

title: Calculate the binned interpolated median — interpolated_median
code: interpolated_median(x = mtcars$mpg, bin_size = 0.50) #> [1] 19

what: Calculate the binned interpolated quantile — interpolated_quantile
title: Calculate the binned interpolated quantile — interpolated_quantile
text: function superceded EPI's current preferred method interpolating quantiles, averaged_quantile().

title: Calculate the binned interpolated quantile — interpolated_quantile
code: interpolated_quantile(x, bin_size, probs = 0.5, w = NULL, na.rm = TRUE)

title: Calculate the binned interpolated quantile — interpolated_quantile
text: x numeric vector R object bin_size size used binning probs numeric; percentile value [0,1] w numeric vector weights length x giving weights use elements x na.rm logical; true, NA NaN's removed x computation

title: Calculate the binned interpolated quantile — interpolated_quantile
text: numeric vector

title: Calculate the binned interpolated quantile — interpolated_quantile
code: interpolated_quantile(x = mtcars$mpg, bin_size = 0.50, probs = c(0.25, 0.5, 0.75)) #> [1] 15.25 19.00 22.50

what: Download a selection of IPUMS microdata extracts — dl_ipums_micro
title: Download a selection of IPUMS microdata extracts — dl_ipums_micro
text: Convenience functions downloading samples variables IPUMS microdata using API package ipumsr.

title: Download a selection of IPUMS microdata extracts — dl_ipums_micro
code: dl_ipums_micro(extract)  dl_ipums_acs1(years = NULL, variables, description = NULL, ...)  dl_ipums_asec(years = NULL, variables, description = NULL, ...)  dl_ipums_cps(months = NULL, variables, description = NULL, ...)

title: Download a selection of IPUMS microdata extracts — dl_ipums_micro
text: extract IPUMS microdata extract defined ipumsr::define_extract_micro() years vector years variables vector variable names, list detailed variable specifications created ipumsr::var_spec() description description extract ... arguments passed ipumsr::define_extract_micro() collection, description, samples, variables months vector dates representing months CPS samples.

title: Download a selection of IPUMS microdata extracts — dl_ipums_micro
text: tibble microdata IPUMS API

title: Download a selection of IPUMS microdata extracts — dl_ipums_micro
text: functions simply wrappers around ipumsr require IPUMS API key saved IPUMS_API_KEY environment variable.

title: Download a selection of IPUMS microdata extracts — dl_ipums_micro
text: dl_ipums_micro(): base function group dl_ipums_acs1(): Download IPUMS ACS 1-year files dl_ipums_asec(): Download IPUMS CPS ASEC dl_ipums_cps(): Download IPUMS Monthly CPS

title: Download a selection of IPUMS microdata extracts — dl_ipums_micro
code: if (FALSE) { # example ASEC download dl_ipums_asec(2021:2023, c("YEAR", "OFFPOV", "ASECWT"))  # example monthly CPS download begin_month = lubridate::ym("2022 September") end_month = lubridate::ym("2024 August") cps_months = seq(begin_month, end_month, by = "month") dl_ipums_cps(cps_months, c("EARNWT", "HOURWAGE2"))  # use dl_ipums_micro with a custom extract extract = ipumsr::define_extract_micro(   collection = "cps",   description = "CPS ASEC extract",   samples = c("cps2021_03s", "cps2022_03s", "cps2023_03s"),   variables = c("YEAR", "OFFPOV", "ASECWT") ) dl_ipums_micro(extract) }

title: Join data frames and create a merge indicator — merge_status

title: State Geographic Codes — state_geocodes

code: state_geocodes

title: State Geographic Codes — state_geocodes
text: data frame 51 rows 8 variables: state_name Full state name state_abb Two-letter state abbreviation state_fips State FIPS code state_census State Census code division Census division number (1-9) division_name Census division name (e.g., "New England", "Pacific") region Census region number (1-4) region_name Census region name (Northeast, Midwest, South, West)

title: State Geographic Codes — state_geocodes

title: epidatatools 1.0.0
text: Better error handling BEA APIs correct bug get_bls() producing duplicate output

title: epidatatools 0.9.0
text: New BEA API helper: get_bea_regional() Allow different API key names BLS, FRED, BEA fetchers.

title: epidatatools 0.8.0
text: New BEA API helper: get_bea_nipa() search FRED BLS series find_fred() find_bls()

title: epidatatools 0.7.1
text: force get_bls() produce numeric values

title: epidatatools 0.7.0
text: added get_bls() get_fred() retrieval BLS FRED APIs

title: epidatatools 0.6.1
text: corrected error dl_ipums_asec() resulting downloaded data

title: epidatatools 0.6.0
text: added passthrough options ... IPUMS microdata extract download helpers dl_ipums_acs1(), dl_ipums_asec(), dl_ipums_cps()

title: epidatatools 0.5.0
text: added averaged quantile functions: averaged_quantile(), averaged_median()

title: epidatatools 0.4.0
text: added interpolated binned quantile functions: binipolate(), interpolated_quantile(), interpolated_median() added IPUMS microdata extract download helpers: dl_ipums_micro(), dl_ipums_acs1(), dl_ipums_asec(), dl_ipums_cps()

title: epidatatools 0.3.0
text: initial pre-release release
